page.title: 18 HOUSING
page.content: The old houses,cottages,terraced, detached,semis are scattered throughout the village.Some are brick, some are stone and very{individual in {style.} Following the second world war,a{ {council housing development}was completed in{1951.}Several have been purchased by former tenants and they are modernising them.Few have garages attached.Some coal fires are still being used. Today Mitford is a{desirable place {to live}for those working in the nearby towns.Eight/ten new executive stone bungalows and houses are presently being constructed.All of them will cost over{Â£85,000-}too much for young local families to buy.
